py_sim.path_planning.dwa module¶

dwa.py provides functions and classes for implementing a dynamic window controller

class py_sim.path_planning.dwa.World(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

Defines a world in which a point can be queried for obstacle collision

inside_obstacle(point: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]) → bool¶

Returns true if the given point is inside any of the polygons defining the world

Parameters:

Point – 2x1 point to be evaluated

Returns:

True if the point is in an obstacle

Return type:

bool

py_sim.path_planning.dwa.compute_desired_velocities(state: UnicycleStateProtocol, params: DwaParams, goal: TwoDArrayType, world: World) → UnicycleControl¶

Computes the desired velocities for the vehicle. This is effectively a single run of the DWA algorithm.

Note that this is a simplification from typical DWA. In traditional DWA, a dynamic window around the current velocities is assumed. This function tries out all velocities within a window. An additional difference is that a line search is made over the rotational velocities and the resulting arc is scaled based on obstacles.

The velocity pair that results in the closest proximity to the goal is chosen.

Parameters:

  • state – The current state of the system

  • params – Parameters used to calculate the control

  • goal – The goal position of the control

  • world – The world in which the vehicle is operating, used to query for obstacle avoidance

py_sim.path_planning.dwa.compute_desired_velocities_classic(state: UnicycleStateProtocol, params: DwaParams, goal: TwoDArrayType, world: World) → UnicycleControl¶

Computes the desired velocities using the classic DWA algorithm where a grid of velocities is evaluated for the best control.

Parameters:

  • state – The current state of the system

  • params – Parameters used to calculate the control

  • goal – The goal position of the control

  • world – The world in which the vehicle is operating, used to query for obstacle avoidance

Returns:

The control values that will result in the state closest to the goal

Return type:

UnicycleControl

py_sim.path_planning.dwa.evaluate_arc_collision(state: UnicycleStateProtocol, params: DwaParams, control: UnicycleControl, world: World) → float¶

Finds the largest value of time for which a collision will not occur along the arc

Parameters:

  • state – The starting state of the unicycle

  • params – The parameters of the DWA

  • control – The control being evaluated

  • world – The world through which the vehicle is navigating

Returns:

The maximum time value without a collision

Return type:

float

py_sim.path_planning.dwa.scale_velocities(control: UnicycleControl, t_coll: float, tf: float) → UnicycleControl¶

Scales the velocities so that the end of the horizon (tf) will occur before the collision

Parameters:

  • control – The desired control values

  • t_coll – The time of collision

  • tf – The desired final time

Returns:

The control values that will result in no collision before the final time

Return type:

UnicycleControl
